title.narrative: COVID-19 UNICEF Quality and Inclusive Education
COVID-19 UNICEF Quality and Inclusive Education

description.narrative:
Reprogrammed funds to address COVID-19 The UNICEF and SIDA Quality and Inclusive Education Support Partnership 2020–2023 is based on past partnerships to assist Cambodia in building a more robust education system that is better able to deliver quality, equitable, inclusive and relevant education, and which can more effectively respond to the needs of all children, including vulnerable children and adolescents. The funding level for this four-year multi-component programme is US$ 8.3 million (SEK 80 million). The programme strives to achieve three main outcomes, consistent with UNICEF Cambodia’s education and broader country strategy for 2019 to 2023 and the Cambodian Education Strategic Plan 2019-2023. They are: Outcome 1: Girls and boys, particularly the most vulnerable, have increased access to learning resources to meet their needs.
Outcome 2: Girls and boys increasingly receive relevant and quality learning in a safe, protective and inclusive environment, including during emergencies.
Outcome 3: Girls and boys increasingly nurtured by parents and communities to attend and complete early childhood and basic education and to embark on lifelong learning. These outcomes will be achieved by structuring activities under four components: Component 1 will help children receive a better quality and more equitable education Component 2 will help children of different abilities and social backgrounds to benefit from inclusive education Component 3 will help adolescents reach their potential through receiving relevant education Component 4 will promote knowledge generation, advocacy and aid effectiveness. The Programme will be carried out during the following activity period January 1 2020 - December 2023

Omprogrammerade medel för att bekämpa covid-19 Partnerskapsprogrammet för Inkluderande kvalitetsutbildning 2020-2023 bygger på ett mångårigt samarbete mellan Sida och Unicef i Kambodja. Programmet syftar till att stödja landets strävan efter att bygga ett robust utbildningssystem som har bättre möjligheter att tillhandahålla kvalitet, likvärdighet, inkluderande och relevant utbildning. System som på ett effektivt sätt tillfredsställer alla barns behov, inklusive olika utsatta barn och ungdomar. Budgeten för detta fyraåriga program är 8,3 miljoner US dollar, motsvarande 80 miljoner svenska kronor. Programmet förväntas bidra till tre resultat: Mål 1: Flickor och pojkar, särskilt de mest utsatta, får i ökad utsträckning tillgång till undervisning som motsvarar deras behov. Mål 2: Flickor och pojkar får i ökande utsträckning tillgång till relevant kvalitetsundervisning i säker och inkluderande miljö, också i krissituationer. Mål 3: Flickor och pojkar blir i ökande omfattning fostrade av föräldrar och omgivning till att delta i utbildning allt från förskola och att genom det påbörja ett livslång lärande.

The overall objective of UNICEF’s Quality and Inclusive Education Support Partnership 2020-2023 is to support Cambodia in providing and assuring more equitable provision of quality education services. This is expected to be achieved through the three outcomes: Outcome 1: Girls and boys, particularly the most vulnerable, have increased access to sufficient relevant learning resources to meet their needs. Outcome 2: Girls and boys increasingly receive relevant and quality learning in a safe, protective and inclusive environment, including during emergencies. Outcome 3: Girls and boys increasingly nurtured by parents and communities to attend and complete early childhood and basic education and embark on lifelong learning.

tag.narrative: 4.1 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla flickor och pojkar fullbordar avgiftsfri och likvärdig grundskole- och gymnasieutbildning av god kvalitet som leder till relevanta och ändamålsenliga kunskaper.
4.1 - By 2030, ensure that all girls and boys complete free, equitable and quality primary and secondary education leading to relevant and effective learning outcomes.
